title: Proton Beams
description: Investigating the properties and impact of proton beams in the solar wind, using data from multiple spacecraft to understand their origin and evolution.

title: Helium Abundance
description: Analyzing variations in helium abundance across solar cycles to better understand solar wind sources and the mechanisms of solar activity.

title: Space Weather
description: Developing predictive models for space weather events by studying the connection between solar phenomena and near-Earth environmental conditions.

title: Suprathermal Ions
description: Exploring the energetic tail of the solar wind ion distribution to uncover particle acceleration mechanisms in the heliosphere.

title: Heavy Ion Composition
description: Using heavy ion composition data to trace the origin of solar wind streams back to their source regions on the Sun.

title: Coulomb Collisions
description: Studying the role of Coulomb collisions in shaping the velocity distributions of solar wind particles as they travel from the Sun to Earth.

title: Kinetic Physics
description: Investigating micro-scale plasma processes, such as wave-particle interactions and instabilities, that govern the macroscopic behavior of the solar wind.
